rounds.name: SQL Basics
rounds.description: Core SELECT, WHERE, and ORDER BY fundamentals

questions.goal: Return all customer rows (all columns).
questions.q: ____ * FROM customers;
questions.hint: The SELECT keyword retrieves data from a table. Use SELECT * to get all columns.

questions.goal: Return each customer's name and their city.
questions.q: SELECT customer_name, ____ FROM customers;
questions.hint: List the column names you want separated by commas after SELECT.

questions.goal: Return each country only once (unique list).
questions.q: SELECT ____ country FROM customers;
questions.hint: DISTINCT removes duplicate values from your results.

questions.goal: Filter customers to only those in Canada.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers ____ country = 'Canada';
questions.hint: WHERE filters rows based on a condition.

questions.goal: Use the equals operator for an exact match.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE country ____ 'Canada';
questions.hint: Use = for exact equality comparisons in SQL.

questions.goal: Require BOTH conditions (Canada AND Calgary).
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE country='Canada' ____ city='Calgary';
questions.hint: AND requires both conditions to be true.

questions.goal: Match EITHER country (Canada OR USA).
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE country='Canada' ____ country='USA';
questions.hint: OR returns rows matching either condition.

questions.goal: Negate the condition (NOT Canada).
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE ____ country='Canada';
questions.hint: NOT negates the condition that follows it.

questions.goal: Sort city Aâ†’Z.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY city ____;
questions.hint: ASC sorts in ascending order (A-Z, 0-9).

questions.goal: Sort city Zâ†’A.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY city ____;
questions.hint: DESC sorts in descending order (Z-A, 9-0).

questions.goal: Return only the first 10 orders.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM orders ____ 10;
questions.hint: LIMIT restricts the number of rows returned.

questions.goal: Check for NULL emails (missing value).
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE email ____ NULL;
questions.hint: Use IS NULL to check for missing/null values, not = NULL.

questions.goal: Check for NOT NULL emails (present value).
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE email IS ____ NULL;
questions.hint: IS NOT NULL finds rows where a value exists.

questions.goal: Find cities starting with letter A.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE city ____ 'A%';
questions.hint: LIKE enables pattern matching with wildcards.

questions.goal: Filter to customers in a set of countries.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE country ____ ('Canada','USA');
questions.hint: IN checks if a value matches any value in a list.

questions.goal: Filter prices within a numeric range (10 to 20).
questions.q: SELECT * FROM products WHERE price ____ 10 AND 20;
questions.hint: BETWEEN includes both boundary values (10 and 20).

questions.goal: Exclude TWO cities using two comparisons (both must be true).
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE city <> 'Calgary' ____ city <> 'Edmonton';
questions.hint: Use AND when both conditions must be satisfied.

questions.goal: Keep prices between 100 and 200 using two comparisons.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM products WHERE price >= 100 ____ price <= 200;
questions.hint: Both conditions must be true for a range filter.

questions.goal: Keep orders after 2025-01-01.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date ____ '2025-01-01';
questions.hint: Greater than (>) means 'after' for dates.

questions.goal: Keep orders before 2025-01-01.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date ____ '2025-01-01';
questions.hint: Less than (<) means 'before' for dates.

questions.goal: Rename a column in the output (alias).
questions.q: SELECT customer_name ____ name FROM customers;
questions.hint: AS creates an alias (nickname) for a column.

questions.goal: Use a LIKE wildcard for any tail characters.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE city LIKE 'S____';
questions.hint: % matches any sequence of characters (including none).

questions.goal: Return rows either outside range OR missing price.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM products WHERE price NOT BETWEEN 10 AND 20 ____ price IS NULL;
questions.hint: OR returns rows matching either condition.

questions.goal: Group OR conditions with parentheses.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE (city='Calgary' ____ city='Edmonton') AND country='Canada';
questions.hint: Parentheses group conditions to control evaluation order.

questions.goal: Sort by country then city, both ascending.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY country ASC, city ____;
questions.hint: Multi-column ORDER BY sorts by the first, then second column.

rounds.name: Aggregates & Grouping
rounds.description: COUNT, SUM, AVG, GROUP BY, and HAVING

questions.goal: Count how many customer rows exist.
questions.q: SELECT ____ (*) FROM customers;
questions.hint: COUNT(*) returns the number of rows in a table.

questions.goal: Find the lowest product price.
questions.q: SELECT ____ (price) FROM products;
questions.hint: MIN returns the smallest value in a column.

questions.goal: Find the highest product price.
questions.q: SELECT ____ (price) FROM products;
questions.hint: MAX returns the largest value in a column.

questions.goal: Find the average product price.
questions.q: SELECT ____ (price) FROM products;
questions.hint: AVG calculates the arithmetic mean of values.

questions.goal: Find the total of all product prices (sum).
questions.q: SELECT ____ (price) FROM products;
questions.hint: SUM adds up all values in a column.

questions.goal: Count customers per country.
questions.q: SELECT country, COUNT(*) FROM customers GROUP BY ____;
questions.hint: GROUP BY groups rows with the same value; list the same column(s) you're selecting.

questions.goal: Keep only cities with 2+ customers.
questions.q: SELECT city, COUNT(*) FROM customers GROUP BY city HAVING COUNT(*) ____ 2;
questions.hint: HAVING filters groups after aggregation (like WHERE for groups).

questions.goal: Keep only customers with more than 1 order.
questions.q: SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(*) ____ 1;
questions.hint: > means strictly greater than (not including 1).

questions.goal: Keep products with average rating 4 or higher.
questions.q: SELECT product_id, AVG(rating) FROM reviews GROUP BY product_id HAVING AVG(rating) ____ 4;
questions.hint: >= includes the boundary value (4 itself).

questions.goal: Keep customers whose total spend is 500 or more.
questions.q: SELECT customer_id, SUM(total_amount) FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING SUM(total_amount) ____ 500;
questions.hint: HAVING SUM() filters groups by their sum total.

questions.goal: Sort countries by customer count (largest first).
questions.q: SELECT country, COUNT(*) FROM customers GROUP BY country ORDER BY COUNT(*) ____;
questions.hint: DESC sorts from highest to lowest.

questions.goal: Filter to customers who DO have an email.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE email IS ____ NULL;
questions.hint: IS NOT NULL finds rows where a value exists.

questions.goal: Match names ending with son OR sen.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_name LIKE '%son' ____ customer_name LIKE '%sen';
questions.hint: OR matches either pattern.

questions.goal: Wildcard for any-length in LIKE patterns.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE city LIKE 'A%'; -- wildcard for any length is ____
questions.hint: % matches zero or more characters.

questions.goal: Require Canada AND one of the listed cities.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE country='Canada' ____ city IN ('Calgary','Edmonton');
questions.hint: Both the country AND city conditions must be true.

questions.goal: Not equal operator (status is NOT Cancelled).
questions.q: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE status ____ 'Cancelled';
questions.hint: <> is SQL's 'not equal' operator.

questions.goal: Sort the between-range results by price lowâ†’high.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM products WHERE price BETWEEN 10 AND 20 ORDER BY price ____;
questions.hint: ASC sorts from smallest to largest.

questions.goal: Count orders that are shipped OR delivered.
questions.q: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM orders WHERE status='Shipped' ____ status='Delivered';
questions.hint: OR counts rows matching either status.

questions.goal: Delivered orders within the 2025 date range.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date BETWEEN '2025-01-01' AND '2025-12-31' ____ status='Delivered';
questions.hint: Both conditions must be true: date range AND status.

questions.goal: Cities with 2â€“5 customers, shown most-to-least.
questions.q: SELECT city, COUNT(*) FROM customers GROUP BY city HAVING COUNT(*) BETWEEN 2 AND 5 ORDER BY COUNT(*) ____;
questions.hint: DESC orders from highest count to lowest.

questions.goal: Show top 5 products priced above the average price.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM products WHERE price > (SELECT AVG(price) FROM products) ORDER BY price DESC ____ 5;
questions.hint: LIMIT restricts output to first N rows.

questions.goal: Sort customer_id ascending after grouping.
questions.q: SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(*) <> 0 ORDER BY customer_id ____;
questions.hint: ASC is ascending order (1, 2, 3...).

questions.goal: Sort by country ascending.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE country IN ('Canada','USA') ORDER BY country ____;
questions.hint: ASC orders alphabetically A-Z.

questions.goal: Exclude Calgary/Edmonton and take first 5 by city.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE city NOT IN ('Calgary','Edmonton') ORDER BY city ASC ____ 5;
questions.hint: LIMIT comes after ORDER BY to take the first N sorted rows.

questions.goal: Use an alias in HAVING to filter totals above 10.
questions.q: SELECT country, COUNT(*) AS total FROM customers GROUP BY country HAVING total ____ 10;
questions.hint: You can reference aliases in HAVING.

questions.goal: Match orders to their customer (only matches).
questions.q: SELECT * FROM orders o ____ JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.customer_id;
questions.hint: INNER JOIN returns only rows with matches in both tables.

questions.goal: Keep all customers even if they have no orders.
questions.q: SELECT * FROM customers c ____ JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id;
questions.hint: LEFT JOIN keeps all rows from the left table, even without matches.

questions.goal: JOIN needs the keyword that defines the join condition line.
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, c.customer_name FROM orders o INNER JOIN customers c ____ o.customer_id = c.customer_id;
questions.hint: ON specifies how to match rows between tables.

questions.goal: Filter joined rows to quantity > 1.
questions.q: SELECT oi.order_id, p.product_name FROM order_items oi INNER JOIN products p ON oi.product_id = p.product_id ____ oi.quantity > 1;
questions.hint: WHERE filters results after the join is made.

questions.goal: Sort results by order_id ascending.
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, c.customer_name FROM orders o INNER JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id=c.customer_id ORDER BY o.order_id ____;
questions.hint: ASC sorts from lowest to highest.

questions.goal: Keep only customers WITH orders (order_id not null).
questions.q: SELECT c.customer_name, o.order_id FROM customers c LEFT JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id=o.customer_id WHERE o.order_id IS ____ NULL;
questions.hint: IS NOT NULL finds rows where a match exists.

questions.goal: Find customers with NO orders (unmatched rows).
questions.q: SELECT c.customer_name, o.order_id FROM customers c LEFT JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id=o.customer_id WHERE o.order_id ____ NULL;
questions.hint: IS NULL finds unmatched rows in a LEFT JOIN.

questions.goal: Filter to positive quantities.
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, oi.quantity FROM orders o INNER JOIN order_items oi ON o.order_id = oi.order_id WHERE oi.quantity ____ 0;
questions.hint: > 0 means positive (greater than zero).

questions.goal: Show highest quantities first.
questions.q: SELECT p.product_name, oi.quantity FROM products p INNER JOIN order_items oi ON p.product_id=oi.product_id ORDER BY oi.quantity ____;
questions.hint: DESC orders from highest to lowest.

questions.goal: Canada customers AND delivered orders.
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, c.customer_name FROM orders o INNER JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id=c.customer_id WHERE c.country = 'Canada' ____ o.status='Delivered';
questions.hint: Both conditions must be true.

questions.goal: Orders for Canada OR USA customers.
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, c.customer_name FROM orders o INNER JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id=c.customer_id WHERE c.country='Canada' ____ c.country='USA';
questions.hint: OR matches either country.

questions.goal: Negate the country condition in a join filter.
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, c.customer_name FROM orders o INNER JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id=c.customer_id WHERE ____ c.country='Canada';
questions.hint: NOT inverts the condition.

questions.goal: Customers with more than 1 order.
questions.q: SELECT c.customer_name, COUNT(o.order_id) FROM customers c LEFT JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id=o.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_name HAVING COUNT(o.order_id) ____ 1;
questions.hint: > 1 means more than one.

questions.goal: Sort by alias total (largest first).
questions.q: SELECT c.customer_name, COUNT(o.order_id) AS total FROM customers c LEFT JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id=o.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_name ORDER BY total ____;
questions.hint: DESC sorts from largest to smallest.

questions.goal: Orders where total item quantity is 3 or more.
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, SUM(oi.quantity) FROM orders o INNER JOIN order_items oi ON o.order_id=oi.order_id GROUP BY o.order_id HAVING SUM(oi.quantity) ____ 3;
questions.hint: >= 3 includes 3 and above.

questions.goal: Products with average rating 4 or more.
questions.q: SELECT p.product_name, AVG(r.rating) FROM products p INNER JOIN reviews r ON p.product_id=r.product_id GROUP BY p.product_name HAVING AVG(r.rating) ____ 4;
questions.hint: >= 4 means 4 or higher.

questions.goal: Filter to rows where rating equals 5.
questions.q: SELECT p.product_name, r.rating FROM products p INNER JOIN reviews r ON p.product_id=r.product_id WHERE r.rating ____ 5;
questions.hint: = checks for exact equality.

questions.goal: Sort ratings high-to-low within the range.
questions.q: SELECT p.product_name, r.rating FROM products p INNER JOIN reviews r ON p.product_id=r.product_id WHERE r.rating BETWEEN 3 AND 5 ORDER BY r.rating ____;
questions.hint: DESC orders from 5 down to 3.

questions.goal: WHERE clause belongs after FROM/JOIN section.
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, c.customer_name FROM orders o INNER JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id=c.customer_id ____ o.order_id > 100;
questions.hint: WHERE comes after all JOINs to filter results.

questions.goal: Limit to the first 10 rows after sorting.
questions.q: SELECT c.customer_name, o.order_id FROM customers c LEFT JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id=o.customer_id ORDER BY c.customer_name ASC ____ 10;
questions.hint: LIMIT comes last to restrict output rows.

questions.goal: Use LIKE wildcard after A (any characters).
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, c.customer_name FROM orders o INNER JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id=c.customer_id WHERE c.customer_name LIKE 'A____';
questions.hint: % matches any number of characters.

questions.goal: Match either of two product-name patterns.
questions.q: SELECT oi.order_id, p.product_name FROM order_items oi INNER JOIN products p ON oi.product_id=p.product_id WHERE p.product_name LIKE '%phone%' ____ p.product_name LIKE '%tablet%';
questions.hint: OR matches either pattern.

questions.goal: Sort by total quantity descending using alias qty.
questions.q: SELECT o.order_id, SUM(oi.quantity) AS qty FROM orders o INNER JOIN order_items oi ON o.order_id=oi.order_id GROUP BY o.order_id ORDER BY qty ____;
questions.hint: DESC sorts highest first.

questions.goal: Unmatched (no orders) customers sorted Aâ†’Z.
questions.q: SELECT c.customer_name, o.order_id FROM customers c LEFT JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id=o.customer_id WHERE o.order_id IS NULL ORDER BY c.customer_name ____;
questions.hint: ASC sorts alphabetically.

questions.goal: Products that have at least 1 review (count > 0).
questions.q: SELECT p.product_name, COUNT(r.review_id) FROM products p LEFT JOIN reviews r ON p.product_id=r.product_id GROUP BY p.product_name HAVING COUNT(r.review_id) ____ 0;
questions.hint: > 0 means at least one.
